Jargon Term: It is recommended that you take a blood thinner for the rest of your life due to the risk of you heart returning to this abnormal rhythm and a risk of stroke from this abnormal rhythm. At a minimum, it is essential that you take a blood thinner for the next 30 days. We have decided to prescribe Dabigatran which is a blood thinner that does not require monitoring. You should take this medication twice a day for the next 30 days. If you do not take it, you have a risk of having a stroke.
We recommend that you take a full dose Aspirin 325mg daily after you stop the Dabigatran.
Dabigatran 75mg by mouth twice a day for 30 days
to prevent a stroke Lasix/Furosemide 40mg by mouth daily for at least 14 days
to remove extra fluid that makes you short of breath Metoprolol 25mg by mounth once a day
to control your heart rate Please start a full dose aspirin (325mg per day) after you complete Dabigatran
Annotation: Aftercare instructions - patient needs to do - Medication

Jargon Term: We recommend that you see a cardiologist in 6 weeks. The phone number for cardiology here is ([**Telephone/Fax (1) 2037**].
Annotation: Aftercare instructions - Upcoming Schedules - Specialist appointment

Jargon Term: Please see your new primary care doctor as detailed below.
Annotation: Aftercare instructions - Upcoming Schedules - PCP appointment

Jargon Term: Please return to the hospital with any symptoms of shortness of breath, palpitations, chest pain, leg swelling or any other symptoms that concern you.
Please weigh yourself everyday and call your doctor if your weight goes up more than 6lbs.
Annotation: Aftercare instructions - patient needs to do - Other

Jargon Term: Please limit your salt intake to less than 2gram per day to prevent heart failure symptoms.
Annotation: Aftercare instructions - patient needs to do - Diet
